body_html:
I think proper broadcasting support for tf.matmul() would pretty clearly be a welcome addition to TensorFlow. There is certainly plenty of interest in it, and it is backwards compatible with how tf.matmul() currently works.

I suspect full support for the semantics of @ as described in #1062 (comment) would also be welcome, but supporting matrix-vector, vector-matrix and vector-vector multiplication with tf.matmul() would warrant more discussion given the potential for confusion.

body:
I think proper broadcasting support for `tf.matmul()` would pretty clearly be a welcome addition to TensorFlow. There is certainly plenty of interest in it, and it is backwards compatible with how `tf.matmul()` currently works.

I suspect full support for the semantics of `@` as described in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/1062#issuecomment-225882004 would also be welcome, but supporting matrix-vector, vector-matrix and vector-vector multiplication with `tf.matmul()` would warrant more discussion given the potential for confusion.
